meanings.definition: A structure that is below or subordinate to another structure.
meanings.sent1: The substructures of the house include the basement and foundation.
meanings.sent2: The engineer examined the substructures of the bridge to ensure its stability.
meanings.sent3: The ants built their substructures underground, creating a miniature city.
meanings.sent4: The substructures of society are often overlooked but essential for its functioning.
meanings.sent5: The intricate substructures of the coral reef provide homes for many sea creatures.

meanings.definition: The underlying or supporting structure of a building or other construction.
meanings.sent1: Inspectors checked the substructures of the skyscraper for any signs of weakness.
meanings.sent2: The substructures of the dam were reinforced to withstand the pressure of the water.
meanings.sent3: The substructures of the sandcastle were so sturdy that it survived the incoming tide.
meanings.sent4: The substructures of the treehouse were meticulously crafted to ensure safety.
meanings.sent5: The substructures of the ancient ruins revealed the architectural genius of the past.

meanings.definition: The foundation or framework of a system or organization.
meanings.sent1: Education forms the substructures of a knowledgeable society.
meanings.sent2: The substructures of the company were solid, leading to its success.
meanings.sent3: The substructures of the puzzle were laid out, waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Trust and communication are the substructures of a healthy relationship.
meanings.sent5: The substructures of democracy rely on the participation of its citizens.
